message_1:
An insurance company knows that the probability of a client filing a claim is 0.2. If a client files a claim, then the probability that they will file another claim in the following year is 0.5. If a client does not file a claim, then the probability of filing a claim in the following year is only 0.1. 

Now, suppose that a client has filed a claim in the current year. What is the probability that they will file a claim in the following year again?
message_2: Given that a client has filed a claim in the current year, the probability that they will file a claim in the following year is 0.5.
